metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10852 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The UNIX pipe which sudo uses to contact SSSD and read the available sudo rules from SSSD has too wide permissions, which means that anyone who can send a message using the same raw protocol that sudo and SSSD use can read the sudo rules available for any user. This affects versions of SSSD before 1.16.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10852` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libipa-hbac0 - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.8
libnss-sss - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.8
libpam-sss - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.8
libsss-certmap0 - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.8
libsss-idmap0 - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.8
